cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.16)

project(Phraim VERSION 0.1 LANGUAGES CXX)

set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD 17)
set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED ON)

set(CMAKE_AUTOMOC ON)
set(CMAKE_AUTOUIC ON)

find_package(Qt6 6.2 COMPONENTS Widgets WebEngineWidgets REQUIRED)

# On macOS build a GUI app bundle (prevents launching a Terminal).
if(APPLE)
  #
  # From https://doc.qt.io/qt-6/appicon.html#using-cmake-on-macos
  #
  # The MACOSX_BUNDLE_ICON_FILE variable is added to the Info.plist
  # generated by CMake. This variable contains the .icns file name,
  # without the path.
  set(MACOSX_BUNDLE_ICON_FILE phraim.icns)

  # And the following tells CMake where to find and install the file itself.
  set(app_icon_macos "${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR}/resources/phraim.icns")
  set_source_files_properties(${app_icon_macos} PROPERTIES MACOSX_PACKAGE_LOCATION "Resources")

  qt_add_executable(Phraim
    MACOSX_BUNDLE
    main.cpp
    Utils.h
    Utils.cpp
    EscapeFilter.h
    MyWebEngineView.h
    DomPatch.h
    DomPatch.cpp
    SplitFrameWidget.h
    SplitFrameWidget.cpp
    SplitWindow.h
    SplitWindow.cpp
    ${app_icon_macos}
  )

elseif(WIN32)
  # On Windows prefer a GUI subsystem build to avoid a console window.
  # This sets the WIN32_EXECUTABLE property so the linker uses the
  # WINDOWS subsystem instead of CONSOLE.
  set_target_properties(Phraim PROPERTIES WIN32_EXECUTABLE TRUE)

  qt_add_executable(Phraim
    main.cpp
    Utils.h
    Utils.cpp
    EscapeFilter.h
    MyWebEngineView.h
    DomPatch.h
    DomPatch.cpp
    SplitFrameWidget.h
    SplitFrameWidget.cpp
    SplitWindow.h
    SplitWindow.cpp
  )

endif()

target_link_libraries(Phraim
  PRIVATE
    Qt6::Widgets
)

target_link_libraries(Phraim
  PRIVATE
    Qt6::WebEngineWidgets
)

if(APPLE)
  set(_qt_sdk "${CMAKE_OSX_SYSROOT}")
  if(_qt_sdk AND EXISTS "${_qt_sdk}/usr/include/c++/v1")
    target_include_directories(Phraim
      SYSTEM BEFORE
      PRIVATE
        "${_qt_sdk}/usr/include/c++/v1"
    )
  endif()
endif()
